<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning and Happy Mother’s Day! </strong>Gotta be a <em>little</em> selfish and use this section to shout out my own mom, right? Thanks for everything, Mom, love you! And, of course, we're dishing a huge helping of gratitude to the rest of the mothers and mother figures reading this. I love you too!</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I’m also happy to report that so far this week we’ve raised more than $3,000 for the National Diaper Bank Network. But there’s still time to add to the total. So, once you’re done reading Sunday Edition, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/refer-a-friend?access_token={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slam the share button</a>, spread the Brew to friends and family, and help us raise even more money for a great cause. We’re donating $1 per referral. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">—Neal Freyman</p>

</p>
</td>

<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers with... Carlos Watson
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/icebreakers-withcarlos-watson" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Carlos Watson headshot" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTkyL2Nhcmxvc193YXRzb24uanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Carlos Watson</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Carlos Watson is an Emmy-winning journalist who has a longer list of travel recommendations than anyone you’ll ever meet. Watson founded the media network OZY in 2013 and spends his time talking to past presidents and tech billionaires on <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyF0994XbriKL_Vss0fTUMw?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Carlos Watson Show</em></a><em>. </em></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Next weekend, you can catch Watson asking more famous people questions at this year’s virtual <a href="https://www.ozy.com/ozyfest/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">OZY Fest</a>, but for now, <em>we</em> ask the questions...</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>You’ve traveled to over 50 different countries, what’s your best travel advice?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Every place I go, I find universities and I find where they play basketball. You'll always meet interesting locals that way.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What is a question that you wish people would ask you?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Why are you not on the Lakers?” I’m a notoriously bad basketball player, but I’m a legend in my own mind. A more serious question...I wish someone would ask me, “What are your favorite books?”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What are you looking forward to right now?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I’m looking forward to the sun, more of it. I'm looking forward to playing pickup basketball. Again, that theme returns. I'm looking forward to seeing some parts of the world again. I'm looking forward to seeing my buddy José at the YMCA. José is 87 this year. He works out two hours most mornings. I haven't seen him in a year and he always encourages me and reminds me when I'm slacking off.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What is an outdated piece of advice that you wish people would stop giving?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Don't worry, it'll be okay.” There are times when it will be and it's good to get that perspective, but there are other times when it's really important to acknowledge that it's not going to be okay unless you do something very different.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Who’s the most underrated TV or movie character of all time?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Hawk from <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kNhT05PH3rw" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Spenser: For Hire</em></a>. Hawk was played by a Shakespearean actor named Avery Brooks. Look it up on Google. Oh my. That's all I can say.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>You’ve interviewed lots of famous people in your career, what’s your favorite question to ask?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I love to ask people the most interesting thing they've ever learned about love—it's a really good insight especially from people like Wynton Marsalis and Ava DuVernay. I love to ask the most beautiful place they’ve ever been. And I love to ask people what their karaoke song is.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What is your go-to karaoke song?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If my sister Carolyn is there, we sing “My Way” by Frank Sinatra together. But if she's not there, then I will happily sing “The Gambler”<em> </em>by Kenny Rogers.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>This interview was lightly edited and condensed for clarity.</em></p>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If your idea of financial and investing news is a Twitter meme account called Billy Two Cents, we need to chat. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">No disrespect to Mr. Two Cents’s followers, but you’re better than that. So how about you turn to experts who’ve been predicting trends and reporting on world-changing financial stories for exactly 100 years: <a href="https://store.barrons.com/shop/us/us/barcentsale21/?trackingCode=aaqxcm6c&cid=BAR_EE_NA_ACQ_NA&n2IKsaD9=n2IKsaD9" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Barron’s</a>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It’s a century of experience and perspective that makes Barron’s uniquely qualified to understand the <em>next</em> 100 years. Plus, resumés don’t get more impressive than this:</p>

<li><span>It’s founder uncovered the original Ponzi Scheme.</span></li>

<li><span>Oh, and Bernie Madoff? It was the first major publication to see through him too.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">So instead of reading a publication that just reports the news, choose one that anticipates it. <a href="https://store.barrons.com/shop/us/us/barcentsale21/?trackingCode=aaqxcm6c&cid=BAR_EE_NA_ACQ_NA&n2IKsaD9=n2IKsaD9" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Barron’s</a> stock picks regularly beat the market, and you can always count on them to be transparent, skeptical, and most importantly, independent. </p>

<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
That's Not What It Said in the Job Description
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/make-work-youre-two-jobs" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Make It Work logo" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Each week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reader-submitted questions</a> about work in 2021. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>“My job is becoming more than what the job description outlined. What should I do?”—Joel, Sacramento</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Hey, Joel, why don't you make this an opportunity to do a check-in with your manager? You’ll want your manager to be aware of the additional work and talk through the expectations for your current role. Speaking with your manager may also help you understand why you’re being asked to do more than expected. Also, let them know if this kind of work is something you might be interested in continuing. Who knows? This could be your chance to grow within the company. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>“I have a very strong urge to quit my job to pursue something I’m actually interested in but am scared to quit. What should I do?"—Marcia, New Jersey   </strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Good on you for wanting to take that leap of faith! I would do a little bit of research before quitting, because it sounds like you’re still trying to figure out what you actually want to do next. An easy way to fumble the bag is to not have a plan. Stick it out at this current job and use it to your advantage. I also hope that you knowing that you’re planning your exit helps with whatever it is you’re feeling about your current role. Good luck and let us know how it all works out!</p>
<div class="gmail_default"><strong>"Why is <span class="il">Kate</span> so beautiful?"—Earl </strong></div>
<div class="gmail_default"> </div>
<div class="gmail_default">Don't know but shoutout to my mama and 'em.</div>
<div class="gmail_default">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Something bothering you at work? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ask Kate for advice here</a>.</em></p>
</div>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Meet a Real-Life Dogecoin Millionaire
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/dude-became-dogecoin-millionaire" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Jasyn Prolifiq headshot" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTc1L2phc3luX3Byb2xpZmlxLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Jasyn Prolifiq</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“I’m just a dude,” Jaysn Prolifiq said. Prolifiq is 33 years old and lives in Los Angeles. He works a 9–5 making YouTube videos for an online hip-hop magazine, he loves his family, and on April 15 he became a dogecoin millionaire.  </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Prolifiq first got into investing a few years ago when he bought his first Tesla stock. He’s always been a saver, resisting the urge to replace his 2004 Toyota Corolla that’s falling apart. “The mirror on the side is broken and every time I try to superglue it, it just melts down the side of the door.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">After watching r/WallStreetBets traders initiate the epic <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/25/gamestop-powered-amateur-investors-continues-defy-reality?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">short squeeze</a> in GameStop’s stock this winter, Prolifiq decided to go all-in on doge. He maxed out two credit cards, borrowed money from family and friends, and put his entire life savings into dogecoin through the Robinhood app. Prolifiq said he invested ~$180,000 into the meme stock when it was less than $0.05 on February 5, and on April 15, exactly 69 days later—an important number in the doge community because of...well...the cultural significance—he broke $1 million in holdings.</p>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">How’d he get there? </h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>February 4:</strong> Elon Musk tweeted that “<a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1357241340313141249?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dogecoin is the people’s crypto</a>” and posted a <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1357236825589432322?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">photoshopped image</a> of him and doge. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>February 7: </strong>By 6:59pm ET dogecoin hit $0.08.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>April 15:</strong> Dogecoin hit $0.29 and Prolifiq became a paper millionaire.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>May 5:</strong> Prolifiq’s holdings rose to $2.7 million when dogecoin hit $0.65, up 13,960.31% YTD and close to its all-time high of $0.69, per CoinDesk.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Last night: </strong>Elon Musk hosted <em>SNL</em>, which, yes, some commentators linked to the run-up in doge prices. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It’s not that crazy to draw the connection; after all, satire is part of dogecoin’s DNA. The crypto was created by software engineers Billy Markus and Jackson Palmer in 2013 as a parody of other “altcoins” (cryptocurrencies other than bitcoin) that were all about getting rich and hoarding digital assets. Its rise has been fueled by social media—tweets, memes, and cultural events like the 4/20 pot holiday—inviting speculative traders who want to make a quick buck.</p>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">Which is also what makes it sketchy</h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Dogecoin lacks infrastructure and practical use cases, says Galaxy Digital Research in its recent <a href="https://docsend.com/view/vutymtgqjf99yrpu?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a>. And while it’s one of the oldest cryptos on the market (a year-and-a-half older than ethereum), it hasn’t seen much real development compared to bitcoin’s bustling ecosystem.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In February, Elon Musk <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u_U_dOOI9us&t=11s" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that people should not be putting their life savings into cryptocurrency. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>So what about the guy who did? </strong>Prolifiq remains bullish about the crypto, but he’s also preparing a content side hustle for whether dogecoin goes to the moon or burns up before it reaches orbit. He’s already bought the web domain www.thedogecoinmillionaire.com and snagged “thedogecoinmillionaire” handles on YouTube, Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“The longer I hold, the more I can create content on top of all of this, even if it goes down, guess what? That's content. People want to see me lose a hundred thousand dollars,” he said. Eventually, he wants to start a record label, buy his mom a house, and, “Once Tesla accepts dogecoin, I'm buying my first Tesla.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Read the Matty Merritt extended cut with a deep dive into doge and the perfect Ben Affleck joke <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/dude-became-dogecoin-millionaire?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>

<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Open House
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It’s Open House o'clock, the only time of day when it’s totally normal to whisper, “I want that,” at your screen. We’ll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess the price. Today’s home is courtesy of the most addicting Instagram account, <a href="https://www.instagram.com/cheapoldhouses/?hl=en" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cheap Old Houses</a>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/1iBkdyBSIkePhfMENH/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Keller Williams Premier Realty</em> </small></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome to the most <a href="https://willowhomes.kw.com/property/LST-6790860572479508480-6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">colorful house</a> in Hagerstown, MD. This 1,772 square-foot duplex was built in 1904 and is within walking distance of the town’s main street. The inside needs a little fixing up, but it’s definitely got the charm that makes you want to quit your newsletter writing job in a big city and renovate a vintage home in a town you’ve never been to. Amenities include:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>4 beds, 1.5 baths</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>A finished(ish) attic</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>10-foot-tall ceilings </span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>A lil’ alcove for your stove</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">So, how much for your next project?</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">$105,000</p>

</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome back to Morning Brew's Meme Battle, where we crown a single memelord every Sunday.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Today's memelord: </strong>Austin in Nashville, TN, with some very relatable content.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><br>  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDEyL21lbWVfY29udGVzdF93aW5uZXIucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 560px;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><br><strong>This week's challenge: </strong>You can find the <a href="https://imgflip.com/meme/UNO-Draw-25-Cards?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new meme template here</a> for next Sunday. Carlos Watson\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/icebreakers-withcarlos-watson\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Carlos Watson headshot\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTkyL2Nhcmxvc193YXRzb24uanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eCarlos Watson\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eCarlos Watson is an Emmy-winning journalist who has a longer list of travel recommendations than anyone you’ll ever meet. Watson founded the media network OZY in 2013 and spends his time talking to past presidents and tech billionaires on \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyF0994XbriKL_Vss0fTUMw?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Carlos Watson Show\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eNext weekend, you can catch Watson asking more famous people questions at this year’s virtual \u003ca href=\"https://www.ozy.com/ozyfest/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOZY Fest\u003c/a\u003e, but for now, \u003cem\u003ewe\u003c/em\u003e ask the questions...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYou’ve traveled to over 50 different countries, what’s your best travel advice?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eEvery place I go, I find universities and I find where they play basketball. You'll always meet interesting locals that way.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is a question that you wish people would ask you?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Why are you not on the Lakers?” I’m a notoriously bad basketball player, but I’m a legend in my own mind. A more serious question...I wish someone would ask me, “What are your favorite books?”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat are you looking forward to right now?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI’m looking forward to the sun, more of it. I'm looking forward to playing pickup basketball. Again, that theme returns. I'm looking forward to seeing some parts of the world again. I'm looking forward to seeing my buddy José at the YMCA. José is 87 this year. He works out two hours most mornings. I haven't seen him in a year and he always encourages me and reminds me when I'm slacking off.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is an outdated piece of advice that you wish people would stop giving?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Don't worry, it'll be okay.” There are times when it will be and it's good to get that perspective, but there are other times when it's really important to acknowledge that it's not going to be okay unless you do something very different.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho’s the most underrated TV or movie character of all time?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHawk from \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kNhT05PH3rw\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSpenser: For Hire\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. Hawk was played by a Shakespearean actor named Avery Brooks. Look it up on Google. Oh my. That's all I can say.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYou’ve interviewed lots of famous people in your career, what’s your favorite question to ask?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI love to ask people the most interesting thing they've ever learned about love—it's a really good insight especially from people like Wynton Marsalis and Ava DuVernay. I love to ask the most beautiful place they’ve ever been. And I love to ask people what their karaoke song is.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is your go-to karaoke song?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf my sister Carolyn is there, we sing “My Way” by Frank Sinatra together. But if she's not there, then I will happily sing “The Gambler”\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003eby Kenny Rogers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis interview was lightly edited and condensed for clarity.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F05%2F07%2Ficebreakers-withcarlos-watson\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Make It Work logo\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eEach week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereader-submitted questions\u003c/a\u003e about work in 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e“My job is becoming more than what the job description outlined. What should I do?”—Joel, Sacramento\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHey, Joel, why don't you make this an opportunity to do a check-in with your manager? You’ll want your manager to be aware of the additional work and talk through the expectations for your current role. Speaking with your manager may also help you understand why you’re being asked to do more than expected. Also, let them know if this kind of work is something you might be interested in continuing. Who knows? This could be your chance to grow within the company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e“I have a very strong urge to quit my job to pursue something I’m actually interested in but am scared to quit. What should I do?\"—Marcia, New Jersey   \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eGood on you for wanting to take that leap of faith! I would do a little bit of research before quitting, because it sounds like you’re still trying to figure out what you actually want to do next. An easy way to fumble the bag is to not have a plan. Stick it out at this current job and use it to your advantage. I also hope that you knowing that you’re planning your exit helps with whatever it is you’re feeling about your current role. Good luck and let us know how it all works out!\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"gmail_default\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\"Why is \u003cspan class=\"il\"\u003eKate\u003c/span\u003e so beautiful?\"—Earl \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"gmail_default\"\u003e \u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"gmail_default\"\u003eDon't know but shoutout to my mama and 'em.\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"gmail_default\"\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSomething bothering you at work? \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAsk Kate for advice here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F05%2F07%2Fmake-work-youre-two-jobs\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Jasyn Prolifiq headshot\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTc1L2phc3luX3Byb2xpZmlxLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eJasyn Prolifiq\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“I’m just a dude,” Jaysn Prolifiq said. Prolifiq is 33 years old and lives in Los Angeles. He works a 9–5 making YouTube videos for an online hip-hop magazine, he loves his family, and on April 15 he became a dogecoin millionaire.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eProlifiq first got into investing a few years ago when he bought his first Tesla stock. He’s always been a saver, resisting the urge to replace his 2004 Toyota Corolla that’s falling apart. “The mirror on the side is broken and every time I try to superglue it, it just melts down the side of the door.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAfter watching r/WallStreetBets traders initiate the epic \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/25/gamestop-powered-amateur-investors-continues-defy-reality?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshort squeeze\u003c/a\u003e in GameStop’s stock this winter, Prolifiq decided to go all-in on doge. He maxed out two credit cards, borrowed money from family and friends, and put his entire life savings into dogecoin through the Robinhood app. Prolifiq said he invested ~$180,000 into the meme stock when it was less than $0.05 on February 5, and on April 15, exactly 69 days later—an important number in the doge community because of...well...the cultural significance—he broke $1 million in holdings.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eHow’d he get there? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFebruary 4:\u003c/strong\u003e Elon Musk tweeted that “\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1357241340313141249?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edogecoin is the people’s crypto\u003c/a\u003e” and posted a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1357236825589432322?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ephotoshopped image\u003c/a\u003e of him and doge. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFebruary 7: \u003c/strong\u003eBy 6:59pm ET dogecoin hit $0.08.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApril 15:\u003c/strong\u003e Dogecoin hit $0.29 and Prolifiq became a paper millionaire.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMay 5:\u003c/strong\u003e Prolifiq’s holdings rose to $2.7 million when dogecoin hit $0.65, up 13,960.31% YTD and close to its all-time high of $0.69, per CoinDesk.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLast night: \u003c/strong\u003eElon Musk hosted \u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e, which, yes, some commentators linked to the run-up in doge prices. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIt’s not that crazy to draw the connection; after all, satire is part of dogecoin’s DNA. The crypto was created by software engineers Billy Markus and Jackson Palmer in 2013 as a parody of other “altcoins” (cryptocurrencies other than bitcoin) that were all about getting rich and hoarding digital assets. Its rise has been fueled by social media—tweets, memes, and cultural events like the 4/20 pot holiday—inviting speculative traders who want to make a quick buck.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eWhich is also what makes it sketchy\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eDogecoin lacks infrastructure and practical use cases, says Galaxy Digital Research in its recent \u003ca href=\"https://docsend.com/view/vutymtgqjf99yrpu?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereport\u003c/a\u003e. And while it’s one of the oldest cryptos on the market (a year-and-a-half older than ethereum), it hasn’t seen much real development compared to bitcoin’s bustling ecosystem.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn February, Elon Musk \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u_U_dOOI9us\u0026t=11s\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e that people should not be putting their life savings into cryptocurrency. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSo what about the guy who did? \u003c/strong\u003eProlifiq remains bullish about the crypto, but he’s also preparing a content side hustle for whether dogecoin goes to the moon or burns up before it reaches orbit. He’s already bought the web domain www.thedogecoinmillionaire.com and snagged “thedogecoinmillionaire” handles on YouTube, Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“The longer I hold, the more I can create content on top of all of this, even if it goes down, guess what? That's content. People want to see me lose a hundred thousand dollars,” he said.
